alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH EMBEDDED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF WASHINGTON...BENNINGTON AND WINDHAM COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers with embedded snow squalls accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. Precipitation will begin as rain in lower elevations before quickly changing to snow. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1107 PM EDT, snow showers with embedded snow squalls were located along a line extending from near Andover to near Williamstown and moving east at 45 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Saxtons River around 1125 PM EDT. Bellows Falls, Westminster and Walpole around 1130 PM EDT. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through these snow showers and snow squalls. rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
